summary: This is a Certificate of Service filed with the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, notifying parties that a motion for Christian R. Everdell to withdraw as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell has been served. It is a procedural document related to Maxwell's appeal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant/appellant in the criminal cases referenced (21-58, 21-770). The document concerns a motion to withdraw her appellate counsel.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney filing a motion to withdraw as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Tammy Torres
persons.context: Court of Appeals deputy clerk listed as a recipient of the notice for this filing.

connections.description: Everdell was serving as appellate counsel for Maxwell, as indicated by the motion to withdraw from that role.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
events.description: Christian R. Everdell files a motion to withdraw as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeals (cases 21-58 and 21-770).

keyFacts: On April 15, 2021, a motion was filed for attorney Christian R. Everdell to withdraw as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document is a Certificate of Service, confirming that the motion was served to the relevant parties via the court's electronic filing system.
The motion pertains to two appellate case numbers: 21-58 and 21-770.
The notice was electronically mailed to an Assistant U.S. Attorney and to Deputy Clerk Tammy Torres.
